apd03812A5E-44D2-486E-B9A2-B778DD9044F4.content:
Control the system identifier light

To find a specific Xserve in a rack of servers, you can use Server Monitor to turn on the server’s system identifier light.

  1. Select the server in the server list.
  2. Click the Info button.
  3. Click the “System identifier light” button.
apd03812A5E-44D2-486E-B9A2-B778DD9044F4.name: Control the system identifier light
apd03812A5E-44D2-486E-B9A2-B778DD9044F4.summary: To find a specific Xserve in a rack of servers, you can use Server Monitor to turn on the server’s system identifier light.

apd4337AA66-9DB5-4957-9BCA-A4F0B6028138.content:
Add lights-out management accounts

Normally, you create one lights-out management account when you first set up an Intel-based Xserve using Server Assistant. You can use Server Monitor to set up additional accounts.

  1. In Server Monitor, select a server, and then choose Server > Edit Accounts
  2. Enter account settings. Choose the account type Admin for someone who can both monitor and control (start up, shut down, and restart) the server. Choose the account type User for someone who can only monitor the server.
  3. Click Add User, and then click Done.
You can also set up lights-out management accounts using the IPMITool command-line tool in Terminal. For information, see the IPMITool man page.
apd4337AA66-9DB5-4957-9BCA-A4F0B6028138.keywords: tcp, udp, well-known, firewall, lights-out, xserve
apd4337AA66-9DB5-4957-9BCA-A4F0B6028138.name: Add lights-out management accounts
apd4337AA66-9DB5-4957-9BCA-A4F0B6028138.summary: Normally, you create one lights-out management account when you first set up an Intel-based Xserve using Server Assistant. You can use Server Monitor to set up additional accounts.

apd58D6B3AE-2C7E-478F-BC9B-A438BF953CC4.alternativeName: Start up, shut down, or restart a server
apd58D6B3AE-2C7E-478F-BC9B-A438BF953CC4.content:
Start up, shut down, or restart a server

You can use Server Monitor to start up, shut down, or restart an Xserve remotely.

  1. Select the Xserve in the server list, then click Info.
  2. In the lower-right corner of the window, click Restart, Shut Down, or Power On.
The Power On button is available only for Intel-based Xserve systems.
apd58D6B3AE-2C7E-478F-BC9B-A438BF953CC4.name: Start up, shut down, or restart a server
apd58D6B3AE-2C7E-478F-BC9B-A438BF953CC4.summary: You can use Server Monitor to start up, shut down, or restart an Xserve remotely.

apd5DF83713-84EF-42BA-A30C-8A471AB5A13F.alternativeName: Add a server to the list
apd5DF83713-84EF-42BA-A30C-8A471AB5A13F.content:
Add a server to the list

To monitor a server, add it to the server list.

  1. Choose Server > Add Server or click Add Server in the toolbar.
  2. Enter the name or address of the server and an account name and password. For an Intel-based Xserve, use the address and account information for the lights-out management (LOM) port.
  3. If you don’t want to enter the account password each time you open Server Monitor, click “Save password in keychain.”
  4. Click OK.
You can also add servers to the list by importing or merging a previously saved list of servers. See Switch server lists.
apd5DF83713-84EF-42BA-A30C-8A471AB5A13F.name: Add a server to the list
apd5DF83713-84EF-42BA-A30C-8A471AB5A13F.summary: To monitor a server, add it to the server list.

apdA63A42D8-4924-4D18-885C-68857071DD68.content:
View server status

Here are several ways you can view server status information.

To see information about a component:

Select a server, click a component button (Drives or Temperature, for example) above the information section at the bottom of the window, and then choose a specific component or sensor from the pop-up menu. You can also click any status or component icon in the Status Summary column.

To switch between detailed and summary views:

Click the “Show detailed status” checkbox, or double-click a component icon in the Status Summary column.

To scan device information quickly:

Hold down the mouse button and drag the pointer over the icons in the Status Summary column.

To display only problems:

Click “Show warnings and failures only” below the server list.
apdA63A42D8-4924-4D18-885C-68857071DD68.name: View server status
apdA63A42D8-4924-4D18-885C-68857071DD68.summary: Here are several ways you can view server status information.

apdA7C3943E-2CCF-4DD4-9110-59B82EF2255E.alternativeName: Set up server status email notifications
apdA7C3943E-2CCF-4DD4-9110-59B82EF2255E.content:
Set up server status email notifications

You can have Server Monitor send email notifications to specific individuals when the status of selected server components changes.

  1. In Server Monitor, select a server in the server list and click Edit Notifications.
  2. Choose the devices you want to be notified about.
  3. Enter the sender name you want displayed in the email.
  4. Type the addresses you want the email to be sent to. (Click Pager if the address is for a pager. Use the Add or Delete buttons to add or delete addresses.)
  5. Choose a priority for the notification.
  6. Enter the subject and message you want displayed in the email.
  7. Choose whether you want the remote server or Server Monitor to send the email.
  8. Click OK.
You can also add servers to the list by importing or merging a previously saved list of servers. See Switch server lists.
apdA7C3943E-2CCF-4DD4-9110-59B82EF2255E.name: Set up server status email notifications
apdA7C3943E-2CCF-4DD4-9110-59B82EF2255E.summary: You can have Server Monitor send email notifications to specific individuals when the status of selected server components changes.

apdD677F1E1-178F-427F-A33D-94A04321C9A0.content:
Switch server lists

When you open Server Monitor, you see the list of servers you worked with most recently.

To work with more than one list of servers, you can save server lists in separate files and then switch by importing the list you want to use. You can also combine lists by merging a saved list with the current list.

To save the current server list:

In Server Monitor, choose File > Export, choose a location, and then click Save.

To switch to a different list:

Choose File > Import, choose a saved list file, and then click Open.

To merge lists:

Choose File > Merge, choose a saved list file, and then click Open.
apdD677F1E1-178F-427F-A33D-94A04321C9A0.name: Switch server lists
apdD677F1E1-178F-427F-A33D-94A04321C9A0.summary: When you open Server Monitor, you see the list of servers you worked with most recently.

apdD7678147-E865-43DA-85E0-94EC3A216B3C.content:
Server Monitor Help

Server Monitor Help

Use this utility to monitor and control Xserve systems.

More help for Lion Server
apdD7678147-E865-43DA-85E0-94EC3A216B3C.name: Server Monitor Help

apdFA711495-65E8-4D76-BFF2-2A6825769A94.alternativeName: View a log of Server Monitor activity
apdFA711495-65E8-4D76-BFF2-2A6825769A94.content:
View a log of Server Monitor activity

Server Monitor keeps a record of monitoring and control activity for each server.

Each log records Server Monitor interactions with the server, not system activity on the server itself. For example, the log shows server status changes, the times when Server Monitor contacted the server, and whether a connection attempt was successful.

To view a log:

Select a server and click Show Log.

To save a log to a file:

Select a server, click Show Log, and then click Save As in the log window.

To clear a log:

Select a server, click Show Log, and then click Clear Log in the log window.
apdFA711495-65E8-4D76-BFF2-2A6825769A94.name: View a log of Server Monitor activity
apdFA711495-65E8-4D76-BFF2-2A6825769A94.summary: Server Monitor keeps a record of monitoring and control activity for each server.

apdFC997FF7-06C6-414C-875F-E073FE22DDD8.content:
Change lights-out management processor settings

Intel-based Xserve systems include a lights-out management processor that lets you communicate with the server even when it isn’t powered on. Normally, you provide network settings and account information for the lights-out management processor when you first set up the Xserve using Server Assistant. You can use Server Monitor to change the lights-out management settings for the server that Server Monitor is running on.

  1. In Server Monitor, choose Server > Configure Local Machine.
  2. Enter account settings. Choose the account type Admin for someone who can monitor and control (start up, shut down, and restart) the server. Choose the account type User for someone who can only monitor the server.
  3. Choose Port 1 or Port 2 from the "LOM uses Ethernet" pop-up menu.Port 1 corresponds to Ethernet port 1 on the back of the Xserve.
  4. Enter network and account settings and click Apply.
Note: Be sure to give the lights-out management processor port its own IP address. Don’t use the same address that you use for the server.

You can also change settings for the lights-out management processor using the IPMITool command-line tool in Terminal. For information, see the IPMITool man page.
apdFC997FF7-06C6-414C-875F-E073FE22DDD8.keywords: tcp, udp, well-known, firewall, lights-out, xserve
apdFC997FF7-06C6-414C-875F-E073FE22DDD8.name: Change lights-out management processor settings
apdFC997FF7-06C6-414C-875F-E073FE22DDD8.summary: Intel-based Xserve systems include a lights-out management processor that lets you communicate with the server even when it isn’t powered on. Normally, you provide network settings and account information for the lights-out management processor when you first set up the Xserve using Server Assistant. You can use Server Monitor to change the lights-out management settings for the server that Server Monitor is running on.
